sections.name: Flea Swarm
sections.text: Flea swarms roil across city streets and rural hinterlands in a hissing, scraping scrabble, draining blood from any creatures unfortunate enough to cross their path.

sources.name: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On

link.name: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On pg. 83
link.alt: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On pg. 83

sections.name: Flea
Flea Allies
sections.text: Flea swarms and giant fleas make for natural pets and monstrous minions for creatures who live in areas of filth and concentrated populations. Goblins and gremlins are unperturbed by fleas' disturbing physiologies and are unfazed (though not necessarily unaffected) by the diseases these vermin carry. Ratfolk have been known to tame giant fleas for use as mounts, and urban-dwelling druids whose magic focuses on blight or disease naturally find much to like about the flea swarms they frequently summon.

sources.name: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On

link.name: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On pg. 83
link.alt: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On pg. 83

sections.text: Fleas are little more than a nuisance in most circumstances, but can be lethal when they grow to monstrous proportions or gather in enormous swarms.

sources.name: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On

link.name: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On pg. 83
link.alt: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On pg. 83

sources.name: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On

link.name: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On pg. 83
link.alt: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On pg. 83

traits.name: Animal
traits.text: An animal is a creature with a relatively low intelligence. It typically doesn’t have an Intelligence attribute modifier over –4, can’t speak languages, and can’t be trained in Intelligence-based skills.

traits.name: Swarm
traits.text: A swarm is a mass or cloud of creatures that functions as one monster. Its size entry gives the size of the entire mass, though for most swarms, the individual creatures that make up that mass are Tiny. A swarm can occupy the same space as other creatures and must do so in order to use its damaging action. A swarm typically has weakness to effects that deal damage over an area (like area spells and splash weapons). Swarms are immune to the grappled, prone, and restrained conditions.

sources.name: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On

link.name: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On pg. 83
link.alt: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On pg. 83

affliction.name: Flea Fever

traits.name: Disease
traits.text: An effect with this trait applies one or more diseases. A disease is typically an affliction.

affliction.context: Drain from flea fever can’t be reduced or recovered from naturally until the disease is cured.

stages.name: Stage 1
stages.text: drained 1 (1d4 hours), Stage 2 drained 1 and sickened 1 (1 day), Stage 3 drained 2 and sickened 1 (1 day), Stage 4 drained 3 and sickened 1 (1 day), Stage 5 dead

ability.name: Suck Blood
ability.requirement: The flea swarm’s last action was Swarming Bites, and it dealt damage to at least one enemy
ability.effect: The flea swarm drinks the creatures’ blood. Each victim becomes drained 1 and the swarm regains 3 HP for each victim drained.

ability.name: Swarming Bites
ability.text: Each enemy in the swarm’s space takes 2d4+7 piercing damage and must attempt a DC 22 basic Reflex save. A creature that fails its save is exposed to flea fever.
